title: John Adams - Death of Klinghoffer - London (2002)
description:
John Adams, The Death of Klinghoffer
Barbican, London
18 January 2002

This semi-staged production opened the BBC Adams weekend, 'John's Earbox' which ran from 18 to 20 Jan 2002.  

Cast:

Christopher Maltman (Captain)
Dean Robinson (First Officer)
Leigh Melrose (Rambo)
Yvonne Howard (Swiss Grandmother)
Nuala Willis (Austrian Woman)
Jeffrey Lloyd-Roberts (Molqi)
William Dazeley (Mamoud)
Andrew Watts (Omar)
Kirsten Blase (British Dancing Girl)
Sanford Sylvan (Leon Klinghoffer)
Catherine Wyn-Rogers (Marilyn Klinghoffer)

BBC Symphony Orchestra, BBC Singers
Leonard Slatkin (conductor), Paul Curran (director) 

Track list:

1. Intro/interview with Adams
2. Prologue
3. Act 1
4. Intro/interview with Adams
5. Act 2

he annual mini festivals at the Barbican are a wonderful opportunity to get an in-depth experience of a composer. This year it was the American John Adams turn. The weekend started off with AdamsÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ controversial opera The Death of Klinghoffer (1990), unfortunately only in a concert performance. It is a great piece with a poignant political edge. The London audience, in the packed Barbican Hall, loved the piece. Alice Goodman, the librettist, managed to sustain ambiguity, taking side neither for the Palestinians nor the Israelis. Adams and Goodman were able to show the suffering and emotions of both parties of the eternal conflict. This is great art! 

 The Death of Klinghoffer is a complex, ambiguous piece which touches current sensibilities and is thought provoking.
